title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

European leaders pledge support for Denmark after Trump's Greenland threats
subhead: Leaders of seven European powers voiced support for Danish sovereignty on Tuesday in response to Donald Trump's remarks coveting the territory of Greenland, which followed the US abduction of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: Swiss officials admit inspections failure at bar where deadly fire occurred
subhead: 'Periodic inspections were not conducted between 2020 and 2025. We bitterly regret this,' Crans-Montana mayor Nicolas Feraud told a press conference in the Alpine ski resort, five days after the disaster at Le Constellation bar.

title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking cease-fire, Cambodia claims an accident
subhead: Phnom Penh called the incident 'an operational error,' while Bangkok stated that one of its soldiers was injured. A December 27 ceasefire had brought an end to three weeks of deadly fighting between the two countries, who have long disputed the demarcation of their shared border.

title: After Venezuela, Greenland fears US annexation
subhead: Following the US military intervention in Venezuela, Greenlanders, Danes and Europeans fear that the White House's next target may be the autonomous Danish territory that Donald Trump has coveted since his first term.

For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhead: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhead: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: In Khartoum, the faces of a martyred capital: 'War cannot kill ideas, nor love'
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (3/6). Le Monde's reporters traveled through the Sudanese capital, which for two years was the epicenter of the conflict. They met with residents, who recounted how they survived despite fear and violence.

title: Greenland is and must remain European
